entry.title: 'When you rhyme off those milestones ...' - Callum McGregor explains what underpins his Celtic success

entry.title: The Ballad of Alfie: Closing refrains are melancholy - Rangers legacy, Beale's view, Celtic clashes

entry.summary: Ange Posteocoglou insists he can’t get hung up on Rangers’ failure to grant Celtic a guard of honour at Ibrox because he regards such gestures as superficial in any case.

entry.title: Celtic have outspent Rangers by £50m - Michael Beale needs big money

The Celtic boss is joined on the shortlist by St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson, Dunfermline Athletic’s James McPake and Darren Young of Stirling Albion.

entry.title: Kevin van Veen: Why Motherwell's 'King' would deserve Player of the Year despite incredible Celtic competition
entry.summary: “We won the treble that year. In fact, the only thing we didn’t win was the Boat Race. And they still gave it to Ginola! Can you believe that?!” Sir Alex Ferguson at his finest. Eight years had passed but there was still incredulity around David Ginola winning the Football Writers’ Association’s Player of the Year award, plus the PFA accolade, in 1999 rather than one of his treble-winning Manchester United stars.

entry.title: Hearts captain reveals reason for red card as he calls for VAR clarity
entry.summary: HEARTS captain Lawrence Shankland yesterday called for greater clarity on VAR in the wake of the controversial red card Alex Cochrane received at Tynecastle on Sunday as he targeted a late push for third spot.

entry.title: 'Obvious it is going to be a red' - Hearts v Celtic decision backed by referee duo who claim VAR was correct
entry.summary: Former referees Stuart Dougal and Dermot Gallagher have backed the decision to send of Alex Cochrane during Hearts’ 2-0 home defeat to Celtic on Sunday.

entry.summary: The Hoops clinch back-to-back titles on Sunday with a routine 2-0 victory over Hearts at Tynecastle.
